Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
Managed to migrate the 6 servers overnight on brand new servers. As I pushed older ones to the limit, and damaged one of em running tests, I didn t want to take risks so just reinstalled and splitted everything.

The good point is now I have a strong howto for install and don t need to rely on billions of textfiles everywhere :p

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
Hello everyone :).
As some of you may already know, this year, I'm candidating for a node in **SH region**.
The past year has been very nice : I learned so much thanks to you all who supported me, it was really amazing.
So amazing that I try to contribute more and more, and to find ideas that could help the community. This led me to the creation of a project called **Barterlly**, and here's the true reason behind my proposal : 
I believe this app, and its future versions can be the starting point of something very useful for the community and help spread the word and attract users and devs into KMD ecosystem : Any dpowed assetchain / coin will automatically be listed on the platform (and all "derivative" ones yet to come ;) )

I won't go into tech details on this post, and will just wish you a good election time, but don't forget ! 

**Support Barterlly, Vote for dwy !** :

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: okay

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: what will happen for the coporate accounts?

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: even for the KYC part, the Company being totally new, I have to find a solution for trusted partners / accounts

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: The call with the lawyer will tell me what I can / can not do, and give me the full path to get something non intrusive, yet secure for everyone

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'd love to know both options üôÇ

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: those informations are vital and sensitive to users, atm, we gather some personal data, like email, and are GDPR compliant, but the first or last name are even more sensitive and far more important than an email address. I know there are options where you can find a trusted partner that validates your accounts, and return results via API. But that type of solution, to be compliant by law, need to be checked, and notified in ToS and other legal disclaimers.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I need to compare everything to find the most secure way

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: a Jumio style would fit, but tbh not knowing the election results, I had to handle the infra costs... at all costs. Most important thing to me was to be able to launch asap being compliant.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Now we know that the whole infrastructure will be funded for a year we can begin to work on additionnal levels.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I could just handle those data myself, but i REALLY want to avoid to handle the storage of ID cards etc... That's not the core of Barterlly, and I want to find the best solution for user privacy and keep everything completely compliant.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Asking the community about their experience on different KYC partners could also be a good option.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I'm not registered everywhere (I mean personally, I passed KYC on Bittrex, and Kraken, but not other exchanges), and process differs depending on platforms. I will rush into anything related to technical stuff, but when it comes to compliance, I want to go step by step even if it needs more time.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
pre-deposit, before offer is accepted, that could speed up the process, and could be a feature, where offer is marked as "transaction is ready to complete" or something.
and if you want to withdraw the offer you could get a refund of your deposit (minus tx fee ofc)

if you have a look 95% of the current offers are insanely stupid, but because there are no deposits in place, no one can make a "bad" trade by accident, unlike you could in hyperdex.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: there are 2 things to consider

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: 1) we re still in beta so yeah people test with crazy offers but those offzrs will tend to be drown on the masses of real offers when we will reach more users. Because people seeing it works will just want their offers to be fulfilled.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: a simple example is... a CEX : you can try to buy KMD for 0.0001 cent or sell at 4 btc each. Noone will answer

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Barterlly isn t different and we can t enforce rates or max spread

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
this would defeat the OTC concept
What is possible, is an option to autocalculate the target coin price when placing the order, on the user side it s just a checkbox, but internally this requires having a pricefeed for every coin listed

Content: 2) Prefilling, I know it can be done in less than a day, on tech side of things
